newsitem.title: UK: GA posts record H1 but competition stiff.
newsitem.headline: GA posts record H1 but competition stiff.

text.p: British composite insurer General Accident Plc on Tuesday reported record profits for the first six months of 1997.
Operating profits climbed to 260 million pounds ($411.3 million), toward the top end of analyst forecasts, up from 193 million pounds last year.
Life profits rose 37 percent to 63 million pounds and GA said it continued to make excellent progress in expanding the UK life business.
But the company said that while it had applied premium increases in personal and commercial motor classes in the UK, competitive pressures on all lines of business remained a concern.
Increasingly competitive market conditions prevailed in all the group's major territories, it said.
An improved underwriting result was recorded in the U.S. reflecting reduced severe weather costs. ($ = 0.632 British Pounds)
